title: Wednesday, 13th June, 2018
bodyHTML:
Blank canvas good morning everyone
11:05 am
BE11:05am

Good morning, hello, hi there. This is Markets Live, FT Alphaville's whatever you know.

Soundbuy Morning
Shrink Morning
BE11:05am

It's World Cup sweepstake day in the office.

ActiveValue1 Morning all
BE11:06am

Which is, as you'd expect for the FT, quite complicated in terms of synthetic structure and involving competitive systems.

Punter Usually when a stock falls 50% on a trading statement its right to buy, so what grey on CNCT?
Tom Dalgleish Evening
Swedish Chef Anybody fancy a takeaway?
11:07 am
BE11:07am

There's a long-short sweepstake organised by Miles, involving both top 16 and bottom 16 teams.

Manxish Morning all. Where am I supposed to get Champagne from now, if not Wetherspoon's??!
BE11:08am

And another one involving double blind number draws where the company lawyer has been roped in as invigilator.

ActiveValue1 The main part of CNCT was a cash cow. Investments into Pass My Parcel and Tuffnells are distractions.
Pseudonym It'll have to be Chilean Cava I guess.
Rick Chasey long-short has been the structure of choice here: Iran & Columbia weren't my idea of a great pick :(
Shrink That's better than simple bland sweepstakes.
BE11:09am

Anyway, we're sworn to secrecy with regards what we've drawn until the books are closed. But I can says that people familiar with my situation feel quite confident about the chances of Spain.

not_a_bot ^ it's ok, JDW is replacing with sparkling pinot chardonnay from Australian budget brand Hardys
11:09 am
undefined
Soundbuy Have you brought in a real monkey with a pin to choose the accumulators...
BE11:09am

I see the Connect knife catchers are with us.

Connect Group PLC (CNCT:LSE): Last: 28.15, down 23.85 (-45.87%), High: 28.50, Low: 17.00, Volume: 6.54m
11:09 am
BE11:09am

Sure! Fill your boots!

Shrink How many people will be paid out? Like Top 4?
Viking1 any further comments on Dixons carphone and data breach?
Swedish Chef Spread betting on the number of yellow cards. That’s what the World needs.
BE11:10am

I mean, it's only lost its CEO and CFO and completely failed to turn around its core business and lost a bunch of money it didn't even know it was losing on some now-shelved nonsense.

Grouchmonkey Morning everyone
BE11:11am

You've got zero visibility on earnings and you have a bunch of historical concerns about cash conversion etc coming back to the fore.

Grouchmonkey Pardon my ignorance but when does the World cup actually start?
littleclenches looks like an activist having a pop at Liberty Global/Telenet ?http://www.lucernecap.com/LetterToBoard_LucerneCapital.pdf
11:12 am
BE11:12am

You've got the warning in January as a companion piece to this one. You have a balance sheet that looks pretty damn fragile and you have a pension liability that's rather significant.

Swedish Chef @grouch after England is eliminated
#REF! I saw a price target being changed from 140p to 40p today... ouch
Soundbuy Other than that..........
BE11:13am

And you have management (what's left of it) still not canning the dividend, even though it's clearly the right thing to do.

BE11:14am

Berenberg, which is shop broker to Connect, says .... well, they say this:

#REF! I'm always very suspicious of any company under £300m market cap that has a bulge brakcet broker. Either its post a spectacular fall from grace or they *think* they are playing with the big guys. Can't be getting much of a service at that level
11:14 am
BE11:14am

We also transfer coverage from Sam England to Eoghan Reid.

pancakes or waffles @Grouch Tomorrow
BE11:14am

Quite a lot of departures at Connect today!

BE11:15am

Anyway, here's the upshot of it.

#REF! "Hi Sam""Hi Eoghan, here's a present for you""what is it?""its a buck. Byeeeeeeeeee"
Grouchmonkey Thanks @pancakes.
11:15 am
BE11:15am

Connect Group has released a trading update this morning
stating that a number of negative headwinds have transpired in the second half, resulting in a significant miss to the company’s earnings guidance for 2018E. The major components of this are a failed recovery in the Mixed
Freight (Tuffnells) business, greater-than-expected losses in Pass My Parcel (PMP) and disappointing volumes of World Cup stickers sales. As a result of this announcement, we reduce our 2018-20E EPS forecasts by c30%. With lower earnings and reduced cash generation, the company has decided to substantially reduce its dividend payment. We assume an 80% cut to the dividend going forward resulting in a full-year dividend of 4.4p in FY 2018E and 2p in FY 2019/20E. At the same time, management changes have been announced, with CEO Mark Cashmore to leave the business once the board has found a successor and Tony Grace to join the group as interim CFO. With the failure of the company to turnaround repeated poor performance in Tuffnells, as well as the departures of both the CEO and CFO, we believe the outlook and investment case for Connect to be unclear at present. We
downgrade to Hold and reduce our price target to 40p.

Airborne Cigar @Grouchmonkey - 30 May 2019 at the Oval
BE11:16am

You have to wonder, did Connect throw in the stuff about World Cup sticker sales being weak as an easy news line for the media?

Airborne Cigar I believe the Sovs are running some propaganda circus in the mean time...
Maverick Talk Talk flying again, upgraded today by Merrills, are we seeing just a short squeeze or is there more to the story...?
Grouchmonkey "World Cup Stickers" that's a bit retro, isn't it? Today's youth don't look up from their screens long enough to get involved with stickers, surely?
BE11:17am

Though I guess there's enough news in the continued failure of the Tuffnells business and the exit of two thirds of the C-suite.

11:17 am
BE11:17am

(@Grouchmonkey: anecdotal, I accept, but my kid's school is in sticker frenzy right now.)

BE11:18am

Worth noting in all this that newspapers and magazines sales remain in line with expectations.

Tom Dalgleish No mention of winner's stickers
Grouchmonkey I'm gobsmacked. Do they buy them online or at the corner newsagent as in the old days?
BE11:19am

The one bit of the business we've been told is in terminal decline. But perhaps "terminal" means predictable.

11:19 am
BE11:19am

Peel Hunt incoming, saying nothing much.

BE11:19am

PHe FY2018E PBT down 11% yoy to £42.6m (EPS 13.8p). On the basis of the statement, there will be a £10m downgrade to forecasts at the minimum resulting in FY2018E PBT of £32.6m at most (EPS 10.6p). The downgrade could be in the region of £15m, which would result in FY2018E PBT of £27.6m (EPS 8.9p).

Finlay The only people I know doing stickers are over 30...
ESM @Be Peel hunt has a prop developer conf today... anything interestign in there post bell way yesterday?
zho @BE >>But I can says that people familiar with my situation feel quite confident about the chances of Spain.>> Spain manager sacked, I'm afraid :-(
BE11:20am

So, yeah, you're in theory paying 30p a share for 8.9p EPS.

11:20 am
BE11:20am

What's important there is in theory

#REF! why buy stickers when you can draw them as per 'Panini cheapstakes'?
Finlay Weren't the analysts pretty bullish on Connect -like only last week?
#REF! Panini cheapskates rather
SoS just had an email from currys apologising for letting my details out.
BE11:22am

(@zho: still confident. Ideal time to act. New guy will be fresh.)

undefined
11:22 am
BE11:22am

Anyway, so TalkTalk

Talktalk Telecom Group PLC (TALK:LSE): Last: 126.90, up 9.3 (+7.91%), High: 128.30, Low: 121.70, Volume: 3.80m
Grouchmonkey @SoS how long ago was it you had the GDPR email from them saying they "take your privacy very seriously......?"
Soundbuy Aye, reporting Spanish manager sacked since AV coming on air......remember............ 'correlation does..........'
BE11:23am

Merrill joining the "simple equals good" club.

Tundra4 Ahh TalkTalk a company that flummoxes.
SoS ha ha @ grouch
11:23 am
BE11:23am

Whereas TalkTalk has historically overpromised and under-delivered, we believe new management and their credible simplification strategy can reverse that cycle. We double upgrade TalkTalk to Buy from Underperform. For the 1st time in 4 years, we see guidance and consensus as achievable, ending the cycle of earnings downgrades; valuation is compelling, in our view, with EBITDA growth through to FY20+; regulatory help is here with the cut in the 40/10Mbps wholesale fee in April 2018 and, in our view, an impending voluntary cut by Openreach of the 80/20Mbps product; and finally the sale of B2B for 12x EV/EBITDA means Net Debt/EBITDA falls to a manageable 2.1x. Pricing remains a risk with Vodafone assuming the mantle of cheapest UK fibre provider @ £20, but this has been the case since September ’16 and yet Talk has delivered +ve net customer adds – the FY19 challenge will be stabilising revenue per user. We lower near-term estimates post FY18 results but increase our DCF-derived price objective to 190p from 140p.

BE11:24am

Same argument, more or less, as Deutsche made the other day.

TheManwithaLongChin Online sticker swapping works fine expect for the occasional thieving posties.
BE11:25am

Which led some people to reheat bid theories, as people always do whenever TalkTalk moves more than 5%.

Grouchmonkey Any news on Inmarsat, by the way?
11:25 am
BE11:26am

Having checked all bid theories out, we've no reason to believe there's anything whatsoever in them. To be clear.

BE11:26am

And Merrill's not a buyer on bid stuff.

BE11:26am

Bigger, well-funded competitors in Sky and Vodafone have organically moved into triple/quad-play – they have little interest in buying some/all of TalkTalk, in our opinion, but it remains a possible source of unexpected upside. The mobile-only competitors, O2 and Three, need fibre backhaul in a 5G environment; unbundled last mile access doesn’t fit with this desire but gives a scale subscriber base overnight.

Tom Dalgleish as in 5G outmoding last mile fibre
11:27 am
BE11:28am

This was always the issue with TalkTalk bid theories. Buying it gives you a few hundred thousand relatively low-margin and relatively price-sensitive customers and 3k or so unbundled exchanges.

Shrink BE just let you know Spain just sacked their manager, but please give Dixons.
Punter Thanks BE for CNCT, helpful but a murky situation, I assume the new guy at Berenberg is passing on what the company is telling him, likewise Peel H unt. Shares may be oversold but I don't like the b/s pre likelihood of write downs so wonder about bank covenants and cash conversion. Think I am going to let others catch the knife if they wish.
BE11:29am

These things have a value, but the value of the latter is disappearing quickly and the former isn't really of any strategic worth that would justify paying a 30% premium.

undefined
11:29 am
BE11:30am

And so, to Just Sell

Just Eat PLC (JE.:LSE): Last: 772.90, down 77.1 (-9.07%), High: 827.80, Low: 771.80, Volume: 2.51m
Tundra4 Bid theories, qu'est-ce que c'est?? Any enlightenment from smarter folks appreciated
BE11:30am

Wow low barriers to entry who'd have thought it.

11:30 am
BE11:31am

The news, in case you missed it, is that Deliveroo's going to let takeaways with their own mopeds onto the system.

BE11:31am

As per this: https://www.ft.com...-852d-d8b934ff5ffa

BE11:32am

Deliveroo said on Tuesday it will add 5,000 UK restaurants to its delivery platform, the latest effort in the company’s bid to better compete with rivals like UberEats and Just Eat.

Restaurants that have their own delivery fleets will be able to tap Deliveroo’s 15,000 riders in the UK under the new service, dubbed “Marketplace+”. The new additions bring the number of restaurants in Deliveroo’s UK network to 15,000.

Marketplace+ will be available in July and aims to help the London-based delivery app strengthen its position in its core UK market. Deliveroo plans to expand into 50 new towns and cities and reach around 6 million new customers in the UK this year.

Stateless @BE - just how far out of the money is the just sell recommendation at this point (assuming it was a short) - disclaimer,I've never held JE
11:32 am
BE11:32am

You know all the arguments here. We've been through them often enough.

Pseudonym Actually used Just Eat the other day, credit card wouldn't work through it so ended up paying the delivery guy cash, in short, functionally equivalent to just phoning up the pizza place direct.
Grouchmonkey Although, according to the supreme court, all deliveroos drivers will now be getting paid hols, on PAYE etc......
BE11:33am

(@Stateless: about 500% I'd imagine. But we're clinging on like a 1970s poster of a cat on a washing line.)

BE11:33am

Just Eat and Deliveroo are different ends of the market. One's chicken shops, the other's Wagamama.

11:34 am
BE11:34am

Except that gap has been closing for a year or two as both companies grow at any cost. Which for JE means tearing up its model and getting its own gig economy battalion, and for Deliveroo means going down to the chicken-shop market.

BE11:35am

Goldman says, "yeah, this is probably a disaster."

BE11:35am

This announcement is important as this places Deliveroo into direct competition with Just Eat’s core profit centre (we estimate the UK marketplace on its own generated more than 100% of Group EBITDA in 2017).

11:35 am
BE11:35am

(Goldman doesn't actually say "this is probably a disaster," to be clear. I was paraphrasing.)

Pseudonym Surely the end state is one giant chicken/kebab/pizza/burger place in a warehouse somewhere?
BE11:35am

While discussions with Just Eat suggest there is limited restaurant crossover between the existing Just Eat and Deliveroo restaurants, it is likely these marketplace restaurants would be more comparable, in our opinion. And while there is still a major tailwind in the UK from the structural shift of takeaway consumers from voice over the phone to over the internet, and despite the high competitive moat that Just Eat’s c.11mn UK customers and savings (reduced electricity tariffs, buying discounts etc) offers restaurants, this is a competitive threat, we believe. However, we would point to the very low levels of customer churn that takeaway platform operators consistently point to across the various companies we cover, which would suggest Deliveroo’s move could be more of a threat to future growth, than the existing customer base.

tangledodyssey Does nobody cook for themselves these days?
pancakes or waffles @Shrink don't think Spain sacked their manager, isn't he just off to Real Madrid once the WC is over?
BE11:36am

So ... assuming JE's UK business is worth £3.9bn (vs a market cap just shy of £7bn at current prices, I think) you have £400m written off the value today.

11:36 am
BE11:37am

So, the UK is now worth 10% or so less.

Airborne Cigar @tangledodyssey - those of us that live six miles from the nearest takeaway surely do...
BE11:37am

Back to Goldman.

BE11:37am

Assuming 5,000 restaurants are achievable for Deliveroo, this would imply a UK restaurant crossover of c.20% (of Just Eat’s 29,000 UK restaurants). If we were to assume the market is applying a linear value to the platform on a per restaurant basis, given the 10% fall in the value of Just Eat’s UK business today by today’s share price move, this implies the market is assuming half the value of these crossover restaurants is lost to Deliveroo. This seems at the high end of the potential impact to us.

11:37 am
BE11:38am

They also say 40%-50% of the UK market has yet to shift to online ordering .....

tangledodyssey I live 20km from the nearest takeaway but would cook my own food anyway.
BE11:38am

So, plenty of growth left for everyone. In theory. Maybe.

Tom Dalgleish Getting-Stuff-to-People is the problem of our age
Peace and Love @tangledodyssey more than ever
Blank canvas I find it odd that people will order a takeaway and then sit watching a food programme about cooking nice meals
Airborne Cigar @to - probably me too, but it's a long time since I was two minutes walk from the kebab shop
lonrho Any ideas why superdry down over 10% in last two days.
Pseudonym Perhaps they should move the people to the stuff and build housing above the chicken shops?
BE11:39am

Cazenove, meanwhile, take the opportunity to push their "Just Eat needs to invest hard to maintain any kind of lead" thing.

tangledodyssey Yes, food programmes for takeaway eaters
11:39 am
BE11:39am

Given JUST EAT’s core customer base is very much skewed towards the lower price segment, direct competition with delivery platforms was limited. Going forward we see several risks from 1) New delivery restaurants on JUST EAT platform partly cannibalizing order growth from marketplace restaurants in the UK; 2) Chains with strong brands in the lower-price segment moving aggressively into the rural areas – JUST EAT's heartland; 3) Deliveroo and UberEATS extending their reach outside of London driving increased competition; and 4) Both players increasingly moving down the price scale and entering JUST EAT’s market.

Pseudonym Haven't you lot seen Man Vs Food?
Blank canvas or they will spend more time watching a food programme than actually cooking in the kitchen
Grouchmonkey @blankC haha yes v good. They also spend thousands on restaurant-quality unused kitchens
Airborne Cigar @Blank canvas - If you're watching the food programme, you're not watching the dinner on the hob - it's a main reason that I cook and my wife does tv...
BE11:41am

JE capital markets day due June 27, incidentally. Might be a bit more interesting than usual.

undefined

Airborne Cigar ... and then suggests that we should try some recipe she's seen...

BornCynic @Pseudoynm - add Drive-ins, Diners and Dives to your viewing. The ice cream parlour that added ground up cake to their ice cream to produce a best seller was a revelation..........

(ROTR: the "people don't cook any more they just watch cooking shows" line of argument has a habit of lapsing into some pretty sweeping generalistions about class and the like, which do us no favours.)

Manxish TBH, Triple D is the cornerstone of my dinner time viewing as well

Okay, what else we got?

not_a_bot if you're looking for stuff...looks like an investor is taking on Telenet/Liberty: http://lucernecap.com/LetterToBoard_LucerneCapital.pdf
BE11:45am

Speaking of pretty sweeping generalistions about class and the like: Superdry.

Grouchmonkey Biffa? Not a v exciting story, but the market reaction to boring results seems a little harsh
11:45 am
Superdry PLC (SDRY:LSE): Last: 1,146, down 74 (-6.07%), High: 1,222, Low: 1,146, Volume: 146.85k
not_a_bot a cynic might link timing of that (published yday) to the odd comment from belgian deputy pm this morning wanting to create a new mobile operator
BE11:47am

Q4 results in May were poor. Ted Baker this week also poor, suggesting all's not well in that particular market niche.

BE11:48am

More generally, though, we seem to have a reset of expectations in recent days with regards how fast Superdry can keep expanding.

BornCynic With regard to stickers - the Guardian did an article. Is it OK to post the link BE?
11:48 am
BE11:48am

RBC said this yesterday:

BE11:48am

Superdry is adjusting to a new normal of lower revenue growth (underlying and space) with cannibalization effects across its channels, operating deleverage in physical retail given declining revenues, and it is attempting to improve its international business profitability.

nichoman ETO has been super strong of late. Is there any renewed chatter there ?
BE11:49am

They say YE2019 margin guidance looks too high, because of the amount of stuff Superdry's having to shove through its discount channels.

11:49 am
BE11:49am

Which, as we've noted before, are plentiful. eBay and TK Maxx being the most visible ones.

SoS Is it actually legal to have these big deliveroo boxes on mopeds?
BE11:50am

we believe Superdry will struggle to generate positive operating margin expansion in FY19E given the slowing nature of revenue growth across channels and we forecast flat EBIT margins in FY19E (11.3%), with retail channel declining by 50bps, and group margins supported by the faster growing and higher margin wholesale channel. We forecast 30bps gross margin decline in FY19E as a result, and are 100bps below consensus (58.0% vs 59.0%).

undefined
11:52 am
BE11:52am

@Nichoman, haven't heard a thing on Entertainment One for ages.

BE11:53am

And think management was presenting at some big media conference last week, so clearly aren't on lockdown.

Manxish US/Mexico/Canada get the 2026 World Cup
Entertainment One Ltd (ETO:LSE): Last: 346.20, up 4.8 (+1.41%), High: 347.60, Low: 342.40, Volume: 161.60k
tangledodyssey Peppa Pig into China with Merlin?
11:54 am
BE11:54am

Though, of course, we know from experience that because they're Canadian they don't have to comply with the Takeover Panel code.

nichoman Yes Peppa was doing well at last results I recall and feel like there's been some renewed interest in it
tangledodyssey Merlin are investing in PP theme parks in China and the US
BE11:56am

Oh, the media conference last week coincided with a big management tour of US investors. So maybe that's helping interest.

BE11:56am

Talking about Peppa Pig and PJ Masks both hitting $2bn in US retail sales.

Excel Developer Tom Newton-Dunn : "Trust in May is evaporating"
11:57 am
BE11:57am

And it's a reasonably easy sell to US investors, arguably. Here's Canaccord from a week or so ago.

BE11:57am

Despite the recent run up in the stock, we note that eOne trades at a notable discount to peers. Its closest comp, Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF.B - NYSE | BUY, US$26 TP) trades at 13.5x F2019E EV/EBITDA vs 10x for ETO. On next year’s estimates, ETO trades at 8.5x EV/EBITDA. While the absence of a North American listing remains an impediment, we continue to see substantial upside to the stock as investor awareness builds.

tangledodyssey ETO actually could become a mini-Disney but Throop couldn't do it, he is fixated on films and sees himself as Mr Film Canada
nichoman @BE Thanks, that probably explains it. Have been watching a lot of Peppa pig lately now I have two 'lil uns
BE11:58am

If there's anything else there, we've not heard it.

11:58 am
undefined
BE11:59am

(@nichoman: the Peppa age-range window is mercifully narrow.)

BE12:00pm

Hey, that's us at midday. We've a WPP trading update crossing the tape as I type.

BE12:01pm

.... though not yet on my RNS feed.
